li.p: a basis where the basis vectors are always written in a particular order, and linear combinations of the basis vectors are always expressed in that order

title.term: coordinates of a vector \uvec{w} relative to a basis \basisfont{B}=\{\uvec{v}_1,\uvec{v}_2,\dotsc,\uvec{v}_n\}

li.p: the unique set of scalars c_1,c_2,\dotsc,c_n so that \uvec{w}=c_1\uvec{v}_1+c_2\uvec{v}_2+\dotsb+c_n\uvec{v}_n

title.term: coordinate vector associated to a vector \uvec{w} relative to a basis \basisfont{B}

li.p: the vector (c_1,c_2,\dotsc,c_n) in \R^n formed by the coordinates of \uvec{w} relative to \basisfont{B}
notation to mean the coordinate vector (c_1,c_2,\dotsc,c_n) in \R^n for the vector \uvec{w}, relative to the basis \basisfont{B} for the vector space that contains \uvec{w}

notation to mean the coordinate vector in \R^n for the vector \uvec{w}, relative to the basis \basisfont{B} for the vector space that contains \uvec{w}, realized as a column vector ( as a column matrix)
